titlestmt.titleproper: Frank B. Riley Photographic Collection circa 1904-1975.
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by MarcEdit
titlestmt.sponsor: Conversion of this record was made possible by a grant from the National Historic Publications and Records Commission, an agency of the U.S. National Archives and Records Administration.

publicationstmt.publisher: Oregon Historical Society Davies Family Research Library

profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS (Describing Archives: A Content Standard)

repository.corpname: Oregon Historical Society, Davies Family Research Library

address.addressline: Oregon Historical Society Davies Family Research Library

physdesc.extent: 7.36 cubic feet (161 photographs, 1 negative, 22 photocopies and glass slides in 16 document cases and 1 oversize folder)

did.abstract: 161 black and white photographs, 1 nitrate negative, 22 pp of photocopies and unprocessed glass lantern slides, ca. 1904-1975, of Frank B. Riley at speaking engagements, events, hiking, posing, etc.; Landscapes and scenery in the Pacific Northwest; Images from his lectures; Etc Frank Branch Riley was a lawyer and lecturer known as "Oregon's Unofficial Ambassador."

bioghist.p: Frank Branch Riley was a lawyer and lecturer known as "Oregon's Unofficial Ambassador."

scopecontent.p: 161 black and white photographs, 1 nitrate negative, 22 pp of photocopies and unprocessed glass lantern slides, ca. 1904-1975, of Frank B. Riley at speaking engagements, events, hiking, posing, etc.; Landscapes and scenery in the Pacific Northwest; Images from his lectures; Etc

accessrestrict.p: This collection is partially processed. For information contact the reference staff of the Oregon Historical Society Research Library, email: Libreference@ohs.org; telephone: 503-306-5240.

userestrict.p: The Oregon Historical Society is the owner of the materials in the Research Library and makes available reproductions for research, publication, and other uses. Written permission must be obtained from the Research Library before any reproduction use. The Society does not necessarily hold copyright to all of the materials in the collections. In some cases, permission for use may require seeking additional authorization from the copyright owners.

prefercite.p: Frank B. Riley Photographic Collection, Org. Lot 7, Oregon Historical Society Research Library.

relatedmaterial.p: Frank Branch Riley papers, Mss 2100, Oregon Historical Society Research Library, Portland, Or.
